questions.question_text: In addition to performing all the standard steps to share data, which privilege must be granted on each database referenced by a secure view in order to be shared?
When a Snowflake user loads CSV data from a stage, which COPY INTO <table> command guideline should they follow?

discussion.content:
B is correct. From Doc: 
ERROR_ON_COLUMN_COUNT_MISMATCH = TRUE | FALSE
Boolean that specifies whether to generate a parsing error if the number of delimited columns (i.e. fields) in an input data file does not match the number of columns in the corresponding table.

If set to FALSE, an error is not generated and the load continues. If the file is successfully loaded:

If the input file contains records with more fields than columns in the table, the matching fields are loaded in order of occurrence in the file and the remaining fields are not loaded.

If the input file contains records with fewer fields than columns in the table, the non-matching columns in the table are loaded with NULL values.

This option assumes all the records within the input file are the same length (i.e. a file containing records of varying length return an error regardless of the value specified for this option).

choices.A: The CSV field delimiter must be a comma character (',').
choices.C: The data file in the stage must be in a compressed format.
choices.D: The data file must have the same number of columns as the target table.
choices.B: The number of columns in each row should be consistent.

questions.question_text: Which governance feature is supported by all Snowflake editions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the right one

questions.question_text:
A user needs to MINIMIZE the cost of large tables that are used to store transitory data. The data does not need to be protected against failures, because the data can be reconstructed outside of Snowflake.
What table type should be used?

choices.B: To delimit the records in the output file using the specified expression.
choices.D: To split the output into multiple files, one for each distinct value of the specified expression.
choices.C: To include a new column in the output using the specified window function expression.
choices.A: To sort the contents of the output file by the specified expression.

questions.question_text: When unloading data with the COPY INTO <location> command, what is the purpose of the PARTITION BY <expression> parameter option?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer is D
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/copy-into-location#optional-parameters
